title: Forget player toxicity, you know what's toxic?
body:
...Being forced to autofill a role you never play and having a hard time of it while watching the person in your preferred role go 0/10.

I am an adult with my own business and two children under 5.  I have very little time to play this game.  When Riot came out with the ability to choose between two roles, I was over the moon, because I could finally focus my limited time on 1-2 roles and specialize in them, rather than having to have a stable of champions for every role.

Then came autofill.  Playing an off-role is now much worse than before, because when I do get stuck with adc/support, I'm rusty as hell because I rarely ever play those positions.  The game is frustrating even if we do, by some miracle, manage to win despite me derping around with my thumbs up my ass.

I've been autofilled support 3 times tonight.  One somebody dodged, once I dodged, and the time I played was as awful as it always is.  Riot, instead of needlessly reworking the jungle for the 524th time, maybe try making supports actually fun to play, so people don't have to be forced to.  Every time I've had to play adc/bot has been so painful, I've decided I'm just going to dodge if nobody will switch with me.  If a lot of people are doing that, how's that going to affect queue times?  That would certainly explain why I see so many dodged games.  I hate to be part of the problem, but I don't want to waste 20-60 minutes of my precious time playing a role I no longer know.  And to all the folks who say, "You should know all the roles," isn't it nice for you that you have time to play the hours and hours that let you cultivate every role.  I don't have time for that, especially since role-selection IS A THING THAT EXISTS.

Oh, and bring back goddamn item sets.  I played Lux support and there was no recommended support page for her (even though she can often go support) and I can't set up my own.  I love item sets, they're great, and I'm stuck with the ones I made months ago for champs I don't even play anymore.

replies.body: If you get autofilled just take janna. easy to play and freelo.

As a support main, please don't. Janna is absolutely useless in low ELO. Why? She's so insanely good at supporting a team, but what happens when the team doesn't know what to do? You're stuck multiplying 1.5 by zero. Pick AP carry supports.

I strongly disagree with you on this matter.

At low ELO, your adc is more prone to fucking up, the enemy adc is also prone to fucking up.

But the difference is, janna has the ability to patch those fuck ups with her kit, while the enemy adc (in theory) won't have anyone to patch his mistakes.

But, everyone is entitled to their own opinions, cheers :).
Nah man just pick brand and oneshot the enemy team.

> [{quoted}](name=GayFluffyUnicorn,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mA4w0ITO,comment-id=0001000000010000,timestamp=2017-01-15T17:54:20.472+0000)
>
> Nah man just pick brand and oneshot the enemy team.

Doesnt work that way. I play Brand a lot. He does a lot of damage. The other day I was playing Brand mid and did (as I often do) much more damage than anyone in the entire match. I did about 80k damage, with the next closest person about 30k behind me at about 52k... the enemy ADC Twitch who carried their team.

Despite just washing the enemy team in boat loads of face melting damage gained by kill gold and CS gold and doing an indisputable amount of freakish damage I was not able to "oneshot the enemy team." To be fair Id get off about one rotation and they would all jump me and my boosted animal teammates couldnt finish them off.

This was on a mid laner income from kill gold and a big chunk of CS.

Good luck with all that on support income, that whole "oneshot" thing...
Highest win rate and 2nd highest playrate above Plat tho.
this ladies and gentlemen is the reason Janna's win rate is below 60%, people think she's easy and pick her without knowing how to play her
people know*
Why would you do this to people? Nobody deserves to play against Janna even more often, this is just cruel and should be considered criminal. :'(

> [{quoted}](name=NoganksOnlyFarm ,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mA4w0ITO,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-01-15T02:33:15.657+0000)
>
> If you get autofilled just take janna. easy to play and freelo.

Or brand or zyra

That's a bit iffy. You need to know how to play a mage to play brand or zyra at bot.

Soraka is somewhat the same, you can't just pick her up and be amazing with her, you need to practice atleast a few games to be decent, I think the same can be said about brand or zyra.

But janna, you need like half a game to learn her.
Proasheck Janna guide: E - E - E - E - E - R

Learn to play supp as i need to learn to play mid, my worst lane.
To deal with autofill, one must get versatility

You obviously didn't read my message, or you'd see that I already wrote why I don't think I should have to learn all the roles if role selection is a thing.  And you will never, EVER get autofilled mid, my friend.  Never seen it happen, and if it does by some fluke, I'm sure somebody will trade with you.

> [{quoted}](name=Maestro80,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mA4w0ITO,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2017-01-15T05:46:38.257+0000)
>
> You obviously didn't read my message, or you'd see that I already wrote why I don't think I should have to learn all the roles if role selection is a thing.  And you will never, EVER get autofilled mid, my friend.  Never seen it happen, and if it does by some fluke, I'm sure somebody will trade with you.

I got autofilled top mid and adc sometimes, i traded mid with supp cause i suck there. The point is : be god in your roles and decent in others, not god in your roles and totally noob in others.
Why learn to play a role you know you dont like rather than playing the role you know you exceed in?

> [{quoted}](name=ItsOrval,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mA4w0ITO,comment-id=00050003,timestamp=2017-01-15T15:23:06.511+0000)
>
> Why learn to play a role you know you dont like rather than playing the role you know you exceed in?

So i can exceed in my best role and be decent / not a total noob, in other roles.

Every time I get filled to support I pick {{champion:90}} and tell my adc "WE'RE GOING HARD. NO PUSSY SHIT! WE WINNING THIS ONE BOYS!" and go sightstone + full AP. If Riot wants to autofill me after the last autofilled guy dodges, I'm gonna play it my way.
as long as you are playing the role assigned, and buying a sightstone, what the fuck ever dude
{{champion:61}} support + {{item:2049}}
I have actually played it, it is quite fun!

So what your saying is; if you don't get what you want your just not going to do it? That's a pretty good lesson, you should teach it to your children.

Your life must be awesome if you never have to do something you don't really want to do.
I don't see how I could make that more clear.

This is GAME. Purpose of game is FUN. 

Autofilled into bad role is NOT FUN.

If bad role = no fun -> defeated purpose of game

This is a game, not real life. If they don't have fun playing a role, it ruins the purpose of the game. They are the ones getting a dodger penalty and saving 4 people the issue of having a bad support.
Question: Do you want to play the game or do you want to sit in queue for 9 hours waiting for the 5 Support mains left in your server to log in

Me? I am all for autofill.

I (generally)feel comfortable playing any role the game asks me to play and will do so happily (usually)as there are champions in every role that I can enjoy playing.

However, there are days where I really just want to play one thing, and am frustrated if I cannot do that. I wouldn't say that it is right or wrong to feel either way.

I do fully understand the people who dislike autofill and feel crippled when autofilled. Does that mean I am on their side, I guess not.

F-for some reason I was expecting a flame answer

Well played.
And Written. Well written.
Kudos

Also, games aren't all for fun. 

Some people enjoy the competitiveness of getting better, even if its on a game, Losing isn't generally fun, but its part of every game, yet we keep doing it for the chance to win.

I enjoy playing league and I enjoy getting better at it.

No one is forcing you to play League. I'd much rather play one game as support and have the next 2 - 5 free in whatever role I want. A small trade off IMO. 

Y'all just complain and whine but what good comes of it? Play by the system and enjoy the parts you can.  

If you don't have the time to play, don't bother with ranked. Stay in blind pick where you can enjoy the luxury of "MID OR FEED!"

I am personally fine with having autofill.
I am comfortable playing any role, and usually don't care where I play, although sometimes I just REALLy wanna play Renekton or something, I am sure anybody can relate.

If you pay close attention, you will see I refrained from using "i" or "me" in the above post, since I personally am all for autofill.

League of Legends is not a chore, a duty, or a promise.  It is a game and a fun pastime, which is less fun due to autofill.

Speaking of teaching, your own parents or teachers should teach you the difference between "your" and "you're."  You'll pardon me if I don't take any other personal advice about raising a family from you either.

So, I enjoyed playing basketball in High School, I wanted to be a Point Guard. Coach wanted me to be a Power Forward, I spose I should of told him to fuck off I wasn't gonna play cause I didn't get what I wanted? I'll make sure to pass that off to my kids.

Either way, a pastime or a chore, being a baby and not doing something you don't want to is still a lame move. We all have to deal with autofill. You should just deal with it like everyone else, but na keep crying, maybe you'll get heard.

This is a fun pastime to us all, what makes your time more valuable then ours?
https://media.tenor.co/images/e02683bdb05a01f755795eef179dbc47/raw?noredirect
LOL

If you [go on the Legacy Client](http://imgur.com/a/qj6WD), you can still make your item sets. They'll stick when you play on the Updated Client.

Hurry though, this feature will only last until they *retire* the legacy client permanently. Which is Soon™, of course.

They confirmed they're actually gonna carry the feature over
http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/features/client-open-beta-update-1

>ITEM SET CREATOR TOOL - likely to slip past open beta

Eventually. Which means there will be an unspecified amount of time where it will **not** be available. Which could be a year or more. Best to stock up on supplies for the drought while you can.
You know whats more toxic, making me stay in a game for 20 min after someone buys an item walks to lane then dcs back to alter.
thats why you should pick singed and go ghost smite then abandon your adc.

If autofill is causing people to dodge they should just get rid of it. I don't mind having to wait a longer time for queue's what I do mind is getting to the end of the champ select screen and someone dodges and I have to do it all over again.

Sad truth of the matter is:

#This Game Wasn't made to cater to *your* lifestyle

So, as much as it might ruin how much fun you have with the game, your time schedule conflicting with your ability to play
**is your own problem**
Amen
Remember the days before you got to choose two roles? So you get autofilled once in a while, boo hoo, I'd rather not go back to the Dark Ages of ques.

https://static1.e621.net/data/29/92/2992572bd4752cce371183f32a706ff8.png
pyukumuku used toxic

Try being a support main who is auto-filled into jungle -- only to see the bot lane go to pieces because a "Teemo support" or "Lux support" wants to be the carry leaving the person assigned ADC deprived of minions and grumpy because he/she is having hard time getting fed.

As for the item page issue, I sympathize because I am still stuck with the same pages I made on the old client.  At least though, if you know what support items are, they aren't too hard to find on the "All Item" page.  (Still it would be nice if they were grouped together in some way.)

Don't pick actual supports till you're in plat, just pick mages like brand/zyra/annie and kill shit.

Also {{champion:432}} {{champion:117}} are fun supports.

Honestly if you play ranked you should be able to play all the roles at least decently. Autofill is obnoxious and should be removed, but us veterans had to play the game where your role was determined by pick order, and you have to be able to play all of them to adapt for your team.

Being one of those veteran players who spent more time playing with Pick Order than with Role Selection, no.
I did not have to play all roles.

Hell, I only played support in less than 1.5% of my ranked games in Season 3 through 5.

Now if I or others weren't dodging, I'd be playing it in at least 20% of my games.
